title: They, Too, Died After Beatings by Guards. No One Raised an Alarm.
summary: Two brutal killings, less than three months apart, in New York State’s prison system raised troubling questions: Had other inmates met similar fates?

title: How Russia Is Brutalizing Its Own Soldiers, and More Than 5 Million Pages of Epstein Files
summary: Plus, the viral video that got the White House’s attention.

title: 6 Takeaways on the Unwinding U.S.-Ukraine Alliance
summary: A Times investigation reveals the inside story of the Trump administration’s chaotic push for a peace deal and its erratic role in the war.

title: Justice Dept. Is Now Said to Be Reviewing 5.2 Million Pages of Epstein Files
summary: The number represents a more precise, and potentially much larger, figure than earlier estimates. The department is seeking to enlist about 400 lawyers to help in the review.

title: Even as Trump Targets Boats in Strikes, Coast Guard Continues Anti-Drug Operations
summary: Cutters are still stopping smugglers and seizing drugs, but the prosecutions of go-fast boat crews are dwindling in a realignment of federal resources.

title: Justice Dept. Leaders Pushed to Charge Abrego Garcia, Emails Show
summary: The release of the emails raised serious questions about whether the Justice Department had misled a judge in telling him that local prosecutors had acted alone in charging Mr. Abrego Garcia.

title: Will the A.I. Boom Continue to Drive Up Stocks in 2026?
summary: The boom in artificial intelligence was the biggest driver of gains in the stock market. That could pose a risk in 2026.

title: The Top Movies of 2025, According to Times Readers: ‘Marty Supreme’ and More
summary: We asked you to vote on the best films of the year. The results ranged from big box office hits to small art-house indies.

title: For Zohran Mamdani, a Crowning Moment, With Challenges Looming
summary: Mr. Mamdani will become mayor of New York City on Thursday, carrying the hopes of the left, Muslims and younger voters as he looks to improve affordability.

title: Mamdani Chooses a Veteran N.Y.C. Education Leader as Schools Chancellor
summary: The selection of Kamar Samuels, who leads schools on the West Side of Manhattan, could help Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani craft his schools agenda.

title: Mamdani Nominates Top City Lawyer and Deputy Mayor of Health
summary: The mayor-elect said the selections indicate his administration’s commitment to help New York City’s vulnerable residents.

title: When the Best New Year’s Plans Are No New Year’s Plans
summary: Many opt out of the revelry, either as their own time-honored tradition or because of a different outlook this year.

title: Tonight’s Ball Drop Is a Celebration of Both the New Year and Times History
summary: The New York Times started the tradition in 1907, and this year’s ball drop will be a reminder that The Times played a role in making New Year’s Eve what it is.

title: New Year’s Eve Forecast Is Very Cold Across the U.S.
summary: Some of the season’s most frigid temperatures are expected this week.

title: An Intense White House Response From a Single Viral Video
summary: A video purporting to expose extensive fraud at child care centers in Minnesota shows the relationship between the Trump administration and self-described citizen journalists.

title: Health Dept. Pauses Child Care Funding to Minnesota, Citing State’s Fraud Scandal
summary: The pause affects a funding stream that provides $185 million in annual aid to the state’s day care centers, as federal investigations into fraud in Minnesota’s social services programs continue.

title: Tatiana Schlossberg, Kennedy Daughter Who Wrote of Her Cancer, Dies at 35
summary: An environmental journalist and child of Caroline Kennedy, she wrote of her struggle with leukemia in The New Yorker in November, drawing worldwide sympathy.

title: Tatiana Schlossberg Was a Kennedy, and a Rookie Reporter
summary: Tatiana Schlossberg, who died on Tuesday, was the granddaughter of John F. Kennedy. But as a journalist, her first editor remembers, she insisted on putting in the work.

title: Iowa Democrat Wins State Senate Seat, Fending Off G.O.P. Supermajority
summary: By holding a left-leaning seat in suburban Des Moines, Democrats ensured that Republicans would not have a supermajority in the State Senate.

title: Ben Nighthorse Campbell, Former Colorado Senator, Dies at 92
summary: A Democrat turned Republican, he was the only Native American during three terms in the House of Representatives and in 12 years in the Senate. He was also a judo expert and an Olympian.

title: The 2025 Politics Yearbook: Most Likely to Be Extreme and Chaotic
summary: How much more chaotic could a second Trump term be? 2025 did not disappoint.

title: Trump Spent the Past Year Trying to Crush Dissent
summary: The next three years will require a vigilant defense of free speech and open debate.

title: From A.I. to Immigration, These New State Laws Will Take Effect in 2026
summary: States across the country have also passed new rules around cellphone usage for minors, medically assisted death and gender-related care.

title: Jon Kyl, Former Arizona Senator, Says He Has Dementia
summary: The Republican served for almost three decades in Congress. He said he was withdrawing from public life after the diagnosis.

title: 3 Hikers Are Found Dead on Mt. Baldy in Southern California, Sheriff Says
summary: The authorities closed access to part of Mount Baldy, the tallest peak in the San Gabriel Mountains in Southern California. They cited dangerous and unpredictable terrain and weather.

title: Isiah Whitlock Jr., Scene-Stealing Character Actor in ‘The Wire,’ Dies at 71
summary: In one of his most enduring roles, he played a corrupt state senator known for his ability to fashion an expletive into an outstretched catchphrase.
